Name Rascal/Libraries/Vis/Figure/Figures/hcat

Function Figure hcat(Figures figs, FProperty props...)
Description Horizontal composition of a list of figures. By default, horizontal composition is vertically centered but all vertical alignment properties can overrule this.

When a horizontal gap property is available, this will be used as gap between the figures.
Examples 
b1 = box(size(50,100), resizable(false), fillColor("Red"));
b2 = box(size(80,20),  resizable(false), fillColor("Blue"));
render(hcat([b1, b2]));
gives:

b2 aligned at the top: 
b1 = box(size(50,100), resizable(false), fillColor("Red"));
b2 = box(size(80,20), resizable(false), fillColor("Blue"), top());
render(hcat([b1, b2]));
gives:

b2 aligned at the bottom: 
b1 = box(size(50,100), resizable(false), fillColor("Red"));
b2 = box(size(80,20), resizable(false), fillColor("Blue"), bottom());
render(hcat([b1, b2]));
gives:

When a property has to be set for several child figures it is convenient to redefine the standard value (using std) of a properties: 
b1 = box(size(50,100), resizable(false), fillColor("Red"));
b2 = box(size(80,20), resizable(false), fillColor("Blue"));
b3 = box(size(80,20), resizable(false), fillColor("Yellow"));
render(hcat([b1, b2, b3], std(bottom()), hgap(50)));
gives:

What is wrong with the above hgap?
